intro: Encyclia dutrae, commonly known as the Dutra's orchid, is a rare and endemic orchid species native to Brazil. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its compact growth habit and striking, often fragrant flowers. The plant typically produces small, greenish-yellow or white blooms with intricate patterns on the petals. Encyclia dutrae thrives in humid, shaded environments, often found in tropical forests. Due to habitat loss, it is considered endangered and requires conservation efforts to ensure its survival.
